title: Football news: Watford just can't shoot straight after failing to strike again
text:
No prizes for guessing what Watford will be working on in the international break.

Quique Sanchez Flores was satisfied his team kept their first clean sheet in 20 league matches, but there are major issues to address in the other penalty box.

The fact Watford have had 113 shots on goal this season — behind only Manchester City, Liverpool and Chelsea — yet scored just four times suggests a whole load of finishing practice awaits.

There are major issues to address up front for Watford going into the international break

Andre Gray was one of the players who missed clear chances for Watford on Saturday

Only 32 of Watford’s shots have been on target, and consequently they have failed to score in five of their eight league games. It explains why they are propping up the division.

They had three such openings here, with Andre Gray somehow missing an empty goal from five yards and Sheffield United keeper Dean Henderson saving well from Danny Welbeck and Craig Dawson.

‘With these attempts, if the players felt more security they would make good decisions with the last pass, and the last shot,’ Sanchez Flores said.

Quique Sanchez Flores shows his frustration as his side draw 0-0 against Sheffield United

It’s a vicious circle, however, because the security of an improved league position won’t come without forwards taking their chances.

Chris Wilder’s Blades may be new to the Premier League but look streetwise enough to avoid a relegation battle. They controlled long spells of this match.

‘I’m delighted with the performance from box to box, but I feel we’re a little light on points,’ Wilder said. ‘We have to marry that performance up with points.’
description: No prizes for guessing what Watford will be working on in the international break. Quique Sanchez Flores was happy with his side's clean sheet but there are issues to address.
authors: Adam Shergold For The Daily Mail
